messageBody:
On Sat, 12 Jun 2004, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> shankris72 wrote:
>
> > The TEST-*.xml does get generated and unfortunately I don't have
> > access to it till monday when I will be at work. Will probably post it
> > then.
>
> OK. The next possibility is that those files are empty or truncated. I
> had that problem with Cruise Control and never got to the bottom of it.
>

There is one problem with ant's xml reports for junit:
ant's formatter includes all the output of the tested class in a CDATA section.
If the unit test outputs itself xml, it may result in a CDATA section included
in another CDATA section, which is strictly forbidden by xml.
I did a quick hack for my project but never had the time to submit a proper fix
to ant. My hack is a patch to ant's xml report that doesn't use a CDATA to
include the test output. Instead, it escapes the '<'.

Best
